subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. In the original description of
P. heterocephalus ,
Fauvel ( 1902 )
specified only one specimen studied (“Un seul exemplaire.”) and provided only data of locality (“ Venezuela : Merida.”). However, we received from IRSNB two specimens with locality label (“Merida / Venezuela ”—presumably Fauvel’s handwritten), an additional museum label with information about Fauvel’s collection, and a type label (“Ex- Typis”), but only one specimen has an identification label (“ heterocephalus / Fvl.”—presumably Fauvel’s handwritten). This was the main reason why we considered one specimen as the holotype (with Fauvel’s identification label) and the other as additional material (without Fauvel’s identification label).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Piestus heterocephalus
may be confused with P. b i c o r n i s (
Olivier, 1811
) or P. v a l i d u s
Sharp, 1876
because they share a similar body coloration. However, in P. b i c o r n i s and P. v a l i d u s the basal distance between the frontal processes of the head is equal to the width of each process and the lateral lobes of the aedeagus are short, never exceeding the apex of the median lobe.
